LucidGuy: its called "Guest Additions", start the Virtual Machine in vbox and click on "Devices" than "Install Guest Additions" and it will mount the virtual CD ROM Image in the Virtual Machine
are you running XP in the virtual machine?
well it should show a CD ROM device on the desktop.. like a disc.. double click it and run the <filename>.run file
did you get the guest additions installed mate?
you installed it via "sudo sh" right?
Guest addtions needs to be installed with admin privileges.. so if your installing it from the terminal it would be "sudo sh <filename>.run" where the filename is vboxguest something something

after you do, and the Guest Additions CD mounts inside the guest.. in the terminal type, "cd /media/cdrom0" then do a "ls" to make sure your in the right directory
do you see the contents of the CD in the terminal? after the "ls" command?
